soptics_validation_shi.json_critique: Requires a working sOPTICS implementation but uses already-fixed hyper-parameters so avoids the harder optimisation stage.
nyu_vagc_processing.json_critique: Only performs basic downloading/cleaning and simple statistics; does not exercise any substantive methodology from the paper.
soptics_implementation.json_critique: Faithfully reproduces the paper’s central technical contribution – implementing LOS-scaled OPTICS and optimising all hyper-parameters on SDSS data.
bcg_identification.json_critique: Recreates the BCG recovery test but piggy-backs on groups already obtained from the previous task, so part of the pipeline difficulty is removed.
shi_catalog_acquisition.json_critique: Involves only downloading and counting catalogue entries; minimal methodological content.
millennium_data_extraction.json_critique: Covers data extraction via SQL but stops before running any clustering, representing only a preparatory step.
clustering_hyperparameter_optimization.j: Demands full implementation and tuning of four clustering algorithms on simulation data, matching the complexity of Table 1.
fof_optimization_sdss.json_critique: Captures optimisation of FoF with a weighted metric on SDSS, but handles only one algorithm so is somewhat simpler than the full analysis.
paper_critique: Tasks cover most core components: implementation/optimisation of sOPTICS, comparison with FoF, multi-catalog validation, and BCG recovery. However several tasks are limited to data download or fixed-parameter evaluation, leaving some methodological depth (e.g., iterative centre refinement, computational scaling tests) untested.
paper_title: sOPTICS: A Modified Density-Based Algorithm for Identifying Galaxy Groups/Clusters and Brightest Cluster Galaxies
